website_summaries.verdict: Sporting a unique play style based on "Crypt of the NecroDancer," this rhythm-action game is an absolute blast as long as you can keep up with its catchy music and bouncy beats.
pros: Move, battle, and adventure to the never-ending beat
Play to the tune of 25 remixed classic "The Legend of Zelda" tracks
Randomly generated levels keep players on their toes
cons: Cadence of Hyrule" is only available as a downloadable game

customer_reviews.title: Oh God the Chickens!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fun game! You have to like rythmic based games or be competent at timing or you'll have a bad time. As you literally cannot move or attack unless you time them to the beat. Liking the Zelda series is a plus too. Music is fantastic and the controls are tight (gives you options to calibrate video and sound if your TV is off, similar to guitar hero). Solo is fun and 2 player is even more fun. Especially when you figure out that you can "accidentally" kill one another with boulders, flame rods and chickens. Never played the original Necromancer, but been having a blast with Cadence of Hyrule so far!
customer_reviews.author: J. Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Let the monsters come to you
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun rhythm game! A must have for any Zelda fan. It's a little hard to get into the groove at first... (Pun intended). You're gonna die a lot. But once you figure it out and how each monster moves then it becomes a blast. I'd only recommend this to more experienced gamers, or anyone looking for a decent challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen

customer_reviews.title: Fun rythm game
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of it it's hard to stop playing. I haven't played Crypt of the Necrodancer but I am a Zelda fan. The game is fairly short. It didn't take me long to complete but it was very enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: gb

customer_reviews.title: The best gameplay\soundtrack combo ever.
customer_reviews.text: I loved Crypt of the Necrodancer (I own it on PS4, PC, AND Switch) and I've always loved zelda, so I'm INSANELY happy those two franchises crossed over. Heavily recommend Crypt of the Necrodancer, Cadence of Hyrule, AND any of the zelda games to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Hildebran

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun game
customer_reviews.text: The music is creatively remixed and the boss fights just keep getting better. A blast!
customer_reviews.author: John Wiswell

customer_reviews.title: Good For Some
customer_reviews.text: 23 year old daughter likes it. I think it’s boring. But to each her own.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlynn

customer_reviews.title: It's a great concept
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the artstyle, and it's difficult, which I like a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Chance

customer_reviews.title: A really nice game, but way shorter than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this game, but it seemed a bit too short. I wish there were more levels / dungeons, items, and collectibles.
customer_reviews.author: Diamondz

customer_reviews.title: It's more a roguelike than a Zelda game
customer_reviews.text: The zelda game made by an indie team.... and it shows. The usual zeldaisms are lacking, and the game has been injected with a large dose of sjw political efforts. But the game itself is astonishingly well made and definitely a lot of fun.... if you like roguelikes. As a fan of both zelda and roguelikes this was definitely enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: April Papke

customer_reviews.title: Worthwile Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyable game. Crossover but still Legend of Zelda-esq. Easy enough to learn the game mechanics, but game can be challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Jones

customer_reviews.title: It's great game
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes it and beat it. From what I've played it's a fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: The game is like a rythm but more of a Zelda game
customer_reviews.text: The game has a rythm like you have to move of a beat but I love the remix themes of Zelda like they did with Hyrule Warriors.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Whitmore

product_meta.title: Cadence of Hyrule: Crypt of the NecroDancer Featuring the Legend of Zelda - Nintendo Switch [Digital Code]
product_meta.description:
Keep the beat as you play as Link or Zelda to explore a randomly generated Hyrule and procedurally generated dungeons. In the latest rhythmic action-adventure from Brace Yourself Games, you can enjoy the gameplay of Crypt of the NecroDancer in the setting of The Legend of Zelda series. As Link—or even as Princess Zelda—you'll explore the randomly generated overworld and procedurally generated dungeons on a quest to save Hyrule. Every beat of each remixed Legend of Zelda tune is a chance to move, attack, defend, and more, so stay one step ahead of each enemy and boss…or face the music. • A rhythmic action-adventure game in the world of the Legend of Zelda series • Explore the randomly generated overworld and procedurally generated dungeons to save Hyrule as Link or Princess Zelda • Use items from the Legend of Zelda series, plus spells and weapons from the Crypt of the NecroDancer game • Outstep legendary enemies and bosses in rhythmic combat • Keep the beat with 25 remixed classic Legend of Zelda tunes Nintendo. Brace Yourself Games. Spike Chunsoft. All rights reserved. The Legend of Zelda and Nintendo Switch are trademarks of Nintendo. 2019 Nintendo.

System Requirements: * Supported Platforms:Nintendo - Switch


Nintendo account required for game activation and installation

Explore the randomly generated overworld and procedurally generated dungeons to save Hyrule as Link or Princess Zelda
Use items from the Legend of Zelda series, plus spells and weapons from the Crypt of the NecroDancer game
